tasks.title: Implement SPARC for Section Research Extraction
tasks.description: Implement SPARC (Section Pattern And Research Content) methodology to improve the extraction of section-specific research content. This should enhance the accuracy of matching research content to the appropriate sections by using a more sophisticated pattern matching approach that considers section headers, content boundaries, and hierarchical structure.

tasks.title: Implement Book Details Module for Title and Subtitle
tasks.description: Create a centralized book details module that loads the book title and subtitle from the outline JSON file once and makes them available throughout the application. This will ensure consistent display of book metadata in all generated content. See project_workbench/book_details_implementation_plan.md for detailed implementation instructions.

tasks.title: Refactor RAG file loading functions
tasks.description: Refactor outline crew and file/PDF loading functions to remove specific RAG outline/prose file names and place those filenames into a configuration file /src/book_writing_flow/config/book_config.py for the chapter or book.

tasks.title: Refactor section prompts configuration
tasks.description: Refactor section prompts out of outline and writer crews (research?) prompt into section-type config file

tasks.title: Refactor section_writer into an agent class
tasks.description: Convert the section_writer functionality into a proper agent class for better organization and maintainability

tasks.title: Expand outline_writer agent with case studies for all chapters
tasks.description: Expand the outline_writer method in outline_crew.py to include case study lists for chapters 2-7, similar to how chapter1_stories is currently implemented. Each chapter should have its own key with relevant case studies that align with the chapter's theme.

tasks.title: Implement file-based research data flow for topic_researcher
tasks.description: Implement a file-based approach to make the topic_researcher work for both outline and chapters. The researcher should execute the research_topic task, save research data to standardized files in the output/research/ directory, and the section_writer should read from these files when generating content. This approach maintains the existing architecture while ensuring research data is properly generated, stored, and utilized.

tasks.title: Learn Roomodes and rules
tasks.description: Study and understand how to create and configure Roo modes and rules for customizing AI assistant behavior. See Roo's roo_rules_guide.md for comprehensive information.
